summary: This bill, the Providing Rigorous Oversight Through Evaluation of Concerning Transactions Act of 2025 (PROTECT Act of 2025), mandates review by the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) of specific greenfield and brownfield investments by foreign countries of concern. It amends the Defense Production Act of 1950 to include these investments in the definition of "covered transaction," requiring declarations for such transactions. This focuses on investments involving real estate and the establishment of US businesses that could be controlled by concerning foreign governments.
